_header: God of Thy goodness grounder of grace
_description: Prayer for assistance for grooms — three alliterative and cross-rhymed quatrains

PULGar151.First Lines:
God of thy goodnes grownder of gracegraunt to thy gromes þat
                    grevun be full sorewith sykes badly and soro set in euery placesaght
                    by vnkyndnes þat I can saye no moreThys worlde ys so wonderfull voyd
                    hyt were…
PULGar151.Last Lines:
…myche musyng one myschiff þat mer[ ] thys to seehertis
                    ha[ ]syd so hyely to ha[ ]e there desire
PULGar151.Note:
Added by a hand of the sixteenth century to a flyleaf at end of volume,
                    with pentrials including, ‘Compleynynge vnto your good and honorable
                    lordship your pore orator and dayly bedman…’.
